website_summaries.verdict: The Sony a9 camera packs an incredible autofocus system, full-frame image sensor, and 4K video, all in a body that's smaller than most SLRs.
cons: Uncompressed Raw capture cuts speed to 12fps
Lens library missing wide aperture super telephoto options

customer_reviews.title: Superb choice!
customer_reviews.text: I used nikon D700 which is still an excellent camera. However, when i met with this Sony A9. I fell in love with all features. Pro: fast focus. Clear and superd viewfinder. Excellent image quality. I wish, there is suitable 35mm 1.4 lens for this camera. Cons: So far, i can tell return button is on the other side. So you have to keep 2 hands runneing around when navigate menu. Return button should be closer to the OK and select button. Price should be about $3500s. There is no $2000 premium needed over A7rii. If you are on budget and not making money out of photography, get the Sony A7Rii
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: The camera use every day as a professional photographer!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I love this camera! I am a professional photographer that does a wide range of photography and videography, and the A9 can handle just about whatever you throw at it! With the right lens it handles low light beautifully, and it can take Incredibly fast burst photos as well if you want to photograph a sports event! The Eye-AF Is a thing of beauty, and no one does bokeh like Sony!
customer_reviews.author: Smarter Outdoors Photography

customer_reviews.title: So glad I finally decided on Sony and the a9
customer_reviews.text: Owning both Canon 5D4 and Sony a7rii, I struggled to make a decision on which system to upgrade as I got into sports photography. So glad I finally decided on Sony and the a9. This camera is amazing! The non-black out shooting is amazing, and once you use it you will never buy another camera for action photography that doesn't have it. My only decision now is if I should buy a second one, or the new a7riii to get that sweet 42mp sensor for non-sports relation shooting. Either way, my 5D4 is going on the selling block as soon as I decide.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Gibson

customer_reviews.title: A9 is probably in the top 3 finest professional cameras made today...
customer_reviews.text: If you shoot sports or 'moving' nature, I might make the argument it's number 1. Absolutely stunning casual use of the most cutting edge camera/shutter/EVF technology. It simply works. Exactly the way you want it to, with no irritations. After 1 week of use I sent it back and re-ordered a A7II based on a PAINFUL self examination and realization that nothing I was shooting was even close to the quality of this box. But if I was still shooting Olympic level sports...THIS is the box!
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for all your needs !
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera . I have the Sony A7Rll and still love that camera but the battery life is horrible . This one last all day so no worries ! Takes a while to get used to the new focus system and figure out what works best for what you are photographing . And 25 resolution is more than enough . Anything else is overkill and takes forever to upload . So this is the one !
customer_reviews.author: L. Lawson

customer_reviews.title: In a word: incredible
customer_reviews.text: An insanely capable, professional grade camera for both photography and videography. Autofocus must be experienced to be believed. Coming from the Nikon D3 and then the D750, it’s unreal how much better this system is.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Aram

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Deal
customer_reviews.text: I have a Sony a7s and was looking for a second Sony with faster autofocus and more pixels to shoot wildlife. I first looked at the 7iii and the 7Riii but with a nice Xmas promotion, I could not turn down the a9 and it’s superior performance
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: !Best camera I’ve ever had
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this camera I use it from everything from portraits to landscape photography and everything in between this camera can do it all and so much more!
customer_reviews.author: Erik Read

customer_reviews.title: Must know how to use the many capabilities of the camera
customer_reviews.text: Menu is easier to navigate than on prior models, but still requires much study to find out what each feature has to offer, then enter that feature into the proper mode. Daunting amount of information that needs to be sorted out.
customer_reviews.author: EMLC

customer_reviews.title: Difficult focus - no problem with the A9
customer_reviews.text: It took a week of shooting with the A7riii to really appreciate the A9. The A9 just nails the shot; low light, through a chain link fence, every lense I have tried including adapted lenses.
customer_reviews.author: shapinup

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I have been a Sony user for many years. This is an upgrade from an a7 for me. I use it primarily with the 24-70 f 2.8 lens and it takes great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Putman

customer_reviews.title: Deception
customer_reviews.text: This camera was shipped to me as a new item but it was used. It is missing the battery and all of the protective packaging and camera body liner. In addition there was make up on the eye piece and on the LCD screen. The camera still had (2) Peak Design Strap Anchor links still attached to the camera. This is GARBAGE that a company would ship this out without quality control inspecting this. Now I have to put off a shoot until the replacement camera arrives. This is very unprofessional and unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Why-Me

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I like everything in this camera. I cannot say anything less with this camera except ..... It did overheat and shutdown on me during a wedding. I dont want to let it go but its unrealiable when exposed to direct sunlight , I did shoot around 30 min under the sun on and off with video and shut down on me. It is very sad since i really like this Camera. 8-6-2017 After the firmware update. It didnt overheat on me and have done 4 more weddings without any problem. Also i've noticed the liveview tends to overexpose at full brightness screen compared to the digital viewfinder. Other than that its almost perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Dodge

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for sports and action!!
customer_reviews.text: Upgrading this from 1 star to four star(due to overheating warning). After many firmware upgrades Sony has fixed the overheat warning issue and has improved the focusing speed, added the amazing eye autofocus, improved the menu system and much more. This camera now has very few if any flaws unless you really want to knit pick. It is a great camera, especially for sports. The focusing capabilities are amazing and the frame rate of 20 FPS make it amazing for sports. If you are doing portraits I would definitely go for the A7R3 as the A9 doesn’t have the resolution or dynamic range the A7R3 has. And I do miss that for portraits.
customer_reviews.author: NomadCC

customer_reviews.title: A camera is an extension of you.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Sony a9, as I started shooting Sports and photojournalist picture taking. I am quite impressed with the speed and accuracy of the autofocus system in this camera. Two card slots and you have a dependable workhorse to pay for itself. I use it for all occasions and has never let me down. This high priced camera has a purpose, remember Sony has lower. Priced models that can take excellent pictures.
customer_reviews.author: charles giallanza

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful camera. The rapid electronic shutter makes street photography ...
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful camera. The rapid electronic shutter makes street photography a dream. No rolling shutter, silence, rapid shots.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley

customer_reviews.title: At this price
customer_reviews.text: You should be able to wake up and say “camera, make coffee”?
customer_reviews.author: Ken Mullikin

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I use it for a wide variety of shooting. I was able to try out through my work and I love it for sports, street, and portrait. Just read that the sensor is one of the best. It made me a better photographer.
customer_reviews.author: Sumner

customer_reviews.title: The a9 has specs that have not been combined in ...
customer_reviews.text: The a9 has specs that have not been combined in one camera before: it's full-frame with 20fps, totally silent electronic shutter with minimal distortion (how much, that is still to be determined), 1/32000s, 3.7MP 120fps EVF, touchscreen, AF joystick, PDAF covering 93% of the sensor, 5-step IBIS, 120fps fullhd, whole sensor 4K at 24p, reasonable battery life (to be determined), double SD cards, FTP and LAN connectivity.. All of that in a camera same size as its predecessors. It's not about one spec only, it's the sum of all specs that has not been possible before.
customer_reviews.author: Đỗ Trung Hiếu (Hieu Do)

customer_reviews.title: ... had the chance to test out the A9 and love it. I think you guys should go to ...
customer_reviews.text: I had the chance to test out the A9 and love it. I think you guys should go to the store and try it out. Will be saving my money on getting one in time for Christmas :)
customer_reviews.author: Quang H. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, but waiting for A9S
customer_reviews.text: I love the improvements, however since I do video, I'm waiting for the A9S.
customer_reviews.author: Rising Star 757

customer_reviews.title: Returned mine after 3 days of overheating issues! Sticking with A7RII and D5 for now.
customer_reviews.text: As an actual full-time professional photographer I can easily tell you this will not replace your Nikon D5, at all! The overheating issue, the rolling shutter, and the lens cost for what is currently available is just not comparable. The A7RII is a better choice if you need a Sony for some reason, but a Nikon D5 and the investment in the future of a 100 year old company that just restructured to take on the shift in mirrorless will surely be the better bet over time.
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like this camera so badly
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this camera so badly! What a let down. I did a comparison test with my A7RII and a Batis 18mm. The A7RII clearly was much better for my needs. I shoot architectural interiors professionally and don't need speed so I never tested the speed part. I was just hoping the high ISO/DR would be better than the 7RII. Nope. Was WORSE!! At 50 ISO the 7RII outshines the A9 as well as at 6400 ISO. However, I did like the feel of the A9 as well as the instant buffer, better EVF and less mushy buttons and dials. But not a huge leap - for my needs - over the A7RII.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

The ability to keep an eye on moving subjects at all times leads to faultless AF and AE tracking, and the photographer’s view is consistently up-to-date with an absolute minimum of lag. In short, the digital promise has been realized at last.
